newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE white sugar trapped in ranges, light trade.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE white sugar trapped in ranges, light trade.

text.p: White sugar futures got off to a slow start on Tuesday with tight price movements on the two nearby months, the only positions traded.
Traders said the August/October spread was valued at around $6.00 and was continuing to widen from the end of last week, possibly reflecting some physical offtake.
At 1100 GMT August was up just 30 cents at $310.50 and October down 20 cents at $304.50. Volume amounted to a light 418 lots.

Physical news was thin on the ground although market sources continued to cite talk that Russia has bought a substantial amount of raw sugar in recent days for tolling opportunities and to boost warehouse stocks.
